PyCEC.collective_variable module¶

class PyCEC.collective_variable.CECCollectiveVariable(universe, initial_resid, target_resid, other_resids=None, backbone=False, ligand=None, ligand_bb=False, cyzone_dim=[8, 8, -8], frame_n=0, warnings_on=True)¶

Bases: object

Class to generate and analyse a collective variable.

Function to create a directory.

Name of the directory to create.

Function to select a set of residues from resIDs that define a CV.

Function to get information about the selection.

select_QM_atoms()¶

Function to select the atoms and waters to be treated with QM from the CV selection.

Function to set the frame number.

Parameters¶

frame_nint, optional

Frame number to set the universe to (default is None)

Class to analyse the collective variable of the CEC system.

get_traj_times()¶

Get the time of each frame in the trajectory.

Iterate through the frames and get the water counts.

Iterate through the frames and get the water counts in a readable format.

PyCEC.plotting module¶

class PyCEC.plotting.CVPlotting(cv_analysis)¶

Bases: object

Class to plot the collective variable of the CEC system.

plot_water_counts(save=False)¶

Plot the water counts over time.

Parameters¶

savebool, optional

_description_, by default False

plot_water_counts_boxplot(save=False)¶

Plot the boxplot of water counts.

plot_water_counts_line(save=False, filename='water_counts_line_hist', test=False, show=False)¶

Plot the water counts over time, with a histogram of frequency to the right of the main plot.

plot_water_counts_violinplot(save=False)¶

Plot the violin plot of water counts.

Module contents¶

PyCEC: A … package for Python¶

Documentation is available in the docstrings and online at <link>

Subpackages¶

Using any of these subpackages requires an explicit import. For example, import scipy.cluster.

cluster                      --- Vector Quantization / Kmeans
constants                    --- Physical and mathematical constants and units
datasets                     --- Dataset methods

Public API in the main PyCEC namespace¶

__version__       --- PyCEC version string
LowLevelCallable  --- Low-level callback function
show_config       --- Show PyCEC build configuration
test              --- Run PyCEC unittests
